items.title: Study of circular DNA comes full circle with use of old technique
items.summary: A 50-year-old lab technique is helping researchers better understand circular DNA, a lesser-known and poorly understood cousin of the linear version commonly associated with life's genetic blueprint. With the aid of a process called density gradient centrifugation, a research team recently published a study that for the first time characterizes all of the circular DNA in the wormÂ C. elegans, as well as in three human cell types.

alternate.title: Study of circular DNA comes full circle with use of old technique

thumbnail.title: Study of circular DNA comes full circle with use of old technique

items.title: Do we need to reform international drug treaties as more countries legalize cannabis?
items.summary: The future of international drug control treaties is in doubt because of recent treaty-violating decisions to legalize cannabis use in Canada, the United States and Uruguay. A professor, whose 2014 review of 20 years of cannabis research made world headlines, thinks so. If decriminalization is the way of the future, he advocates a cautious approach to policy reform that would involve trialing and evaluating the effects of incrementally more liberal drug policies.

alternate.title: Do we need to reform international drug treaties as more countries legalize cannabis?
